name: Avoid using comments in SQL queries (PeopleSoft)
description:
Using pattern-matching engine, this rule reports PeopleSoft SQL Definitions having comments inside the SQL statement.
The 2 styles of comment are searched (/* and --).
output:
This report lists all PeopleSoft SQL Definitions having comments. It provides the following information:
- PeopleSoft SQL Definitions full name.
rationale:
PeopleSoft treats the SQL in a SQL object as a single line no matter how you've formatted it in the editor.
So the comment inside the SQL Definition invalidates the statement.
reference:
Rules of construction of SQL Query.
https://it.toolbox.com/question/what-is-the-comment-symbol-in-sql-editor-100114
remediation: Remove the comment from the SQL statement, and place it in the Comment Field of the SQL definition itself.
alternativeName: Avoid using comments in SQL queries (PeopleSoft)
